sense.name: modesty
sense.commentary: reticence, taciturnity - formality and propriety of manner; the trait of being uncommunicative
sense.examples: His reserve is often perceived as rudeness.

sense.name: backup
sense.commentary: backlog, stockpile - something or someone being saved for future use or a special purpose
sense.examples: My cookie reserve is well hidden. If our star player is injured, we have a reserve to take his place.

sense.name: land
sense.commentary: reservation - a district that is reserved for particular purpose
sense.examples: The hippies have raised money to protect the wildlife reserve.

sense.name: capacity to respond
sense.commentary: potential capacity to respond in order to maintain vital functions

sense.name: emergency forces
sense.commentary: military reserve - armed forces that are not on active duty but can be called in an emergency
sense.examples: I was told that they might start calling in the reserves soon. My cousin Harry is in the reserves.
